text: my counselor said you want to be

too many AP classes find themselves
staying up until 2:00 or 3:00 in the
morning just to finish their homework
before you even take an AP class you
have to sign a contract saying that you
will not drop the class under any
circumstances the courses of runaway
train there's no way we can cover all
the material in one year it's impossible
it will infect the very cell that is I
teach ap biology this is the equivalent
of a college-level course two sometimes
three semesters what do we do we go as
fast as we can
and the students absorb some of it maybe
our courses are designed to create
multitaskers who can read as much

so they can regurgitate it for the next
exam I feel like I'm doing a disservice
to the students because I'm sacrificing
quality of content for quantity of
content the heart of my classes are not
only doesn't mean the more looks I have
but also the wider range of scholarships
I can apply to you know being African
American and taking AP classes is what
people are looking for homework given by
AP or honor classes is a time consuming
so you can't stay up no 11:00 12:00 1:00
o'clock in the morning to honk each
night I want the a I want that be I want
that 3.5 that 3.8 that 4.0 AP students
have way more to do than they have hours
in the day what are we doing to our kids
when we put them through this system
that doesn't allow them to get enough
sleep and causes them to be ramped up
and stressed out I've dropped one AP
class throughout high school and the
teacher gave my reason oh you can drop
it if you have a medical problem that I
had to get a doctor's note because I had
signs of stress all my joints swelled
and I couldn't walk without pain
I'm doing this so I can go to college
and get a job I like ultimately so I can
be happy but if I'm not healthy then
none of that really matters it just
doesn't really seem to add up I feel
that I've been a perpetrator of the
madness in a sense because I've gone out
and I've told kids you know you've got
to take this AP this you know honors you
have to take as many as you can because
we want to see if you've taken total
advantage of the opportunities that are
available to you at your high school and
I don't think that we really realize the
pressure and the stress that is on these
kids to perform one of the original
purposes of AP classes was to give
students a jump start on taking college
courses and I think there was some
belief that there were some students who
are really ready to take college-level
courses
unfortunately it's turned into a kind of
gatekeeper to many universities so now
it's not going deeper really challenging
yourself it's how many AP classes can I
rack up so that I have more AP classes
than the people that I'm competing with
high school now has become preparation
for the college application not even for
college just the college application and
it creates a mentality that was
expressed very well by my daughter after
her French AP test she said I never have
to speak French again
in order for students to have a more
valuable experience from their high
school years they're going to have to
decide I don't need to take five AP
classes I'm going to take AP English
because I really enjoy literature and
that's the real reason I'm taking it not
because I want to boost my GPA but
honestly the best thing to do would be
to get rid of the AP program and just
